intro: Chlorophytum clivorum, commonly known as the African spear lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its tall, strap-like leaves that are often blue-green in color, with a white or yellow midrib. The plant produces striking, sword-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue, emerging from the base of the leaves. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is well adapted to arid environments. Chlorophytum clivorum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
